title: (x) Silver Bullet Comics "Never miss" - Rock it! {Mike F}
content:
Can anyone help me identify this font? The part that says "NEVER MISS"

Sample obtained from: [http://www.silverbulletcomics.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101113459/http:/www.silverbulletcomics.com/ "http://www.silverbulletcomics.com/")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [silverbullet.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101113459/http:/typophile.com/files/silverbullet.jpg) | 44.03 KB |
author: zalmoxe

comments.content: Appears to be [Fenotype's](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101113459/http:/www.fenotype.com/font/fontpage.htm) (Emil Bertell) 'Rock It!' (about 1/3 of the way down the page).

Mike, I think 'Rock It' looks like a grunged House Gothic, but it doesn't really match the 'Never Miss' sample. Look at the E, which is not symmetrical. I suppose you could 'manufacture' one using the Rock It/House Gothic F& E. And the V looks like an inverted N.

- Mike Yanega
I think Mike F nailed it with _Rock It!_. All the letters match (down to the dirt), _Rock It! - deluxe_ from the same page is another story though.

My bad -- I looked at Rock It Deluxe. _never mind_

- Mike Yanega
Thanks a bunch Mike F, as well as all the rest who took the time to reply. Much appreciated. :)
